subject: Baseball
lead_paragraph: Randy Wolf and San Diego agreed in principle to a one-year deal. Wolf, a left-handed starter, will earn about $9 million if he bounces back from shoulder surgery and meets all his performance bonuses. The deal is contingent on Wolf’s passing a physical. Wolf went 9-6 with the Los Angeles Dodgers last season, but did not pitch after July 3 because of soreness in his left shoulder.
